day_1.speaker: DaVinci
day_1.message: Haha, friend! Imagine you just found 100 million in your mailbox—what wild and wonderful adventure would you dive into first? Don’t hold back, I want to hear your boldest, most awesome dream!
day_1.response: Hello all, I am new here

day_1.speaker: DaVinci
day_1.message: Haha, welcome, welcome, friend! So awesome to have you here in our ShareHouse! Now, spill the beans—if you suddenly got 100 million bucks, what’s the wildest, craziest thing you’d do? Build a castle? Travel the world in a hot air balloon? Turn your backyard into a theme park? Don’t hold back—this is the place for BIG dreams and big laughs! Come on, let’s hear your awesome adventure!
day_1.response: I will travel and explore the world for about 9 months and then focus on finding God/truth

day_1.speaker: Donatello
day_1.message: Very fascinating plan! Now, let's analyze this realistically: if you had to allocate that 100 million, how would you divide it among travel expenses, personal growth or spiritual pursuits, and maybe some savings for the future? What rough proportions make the most sense to you?
day_1.response: I mean ofc i am not gonna use the 100mil, I will invest it somehwere where I can get like 5-7% return and then use that 5-7mil for what I want to do

day_1.speaker: Michelangelo
day_1.message: Wow, your plan already shines with such clarity and purpose! Now I’m curious—what is truly fueling this dream of yours? Is it a clear, shining goal that guides every step like a compass, or is it more of a deep, heartfelt call from your values and emotions that pushes you forward? Art and life both need that spark—what’s the soul of your journey?
day_1.response: travel/experience for seeing the world, finding truth because it is what matters in the ned

day_2.speaker: Raffaello
day_2.message: Oh... while we're on the topic of maintaining quality in our lives, I couldn't help but notice the shared refrigerator space is a bit... cramped lately. I'm not being picky, but all those packaged foods seem to crowd out the fresh ingredients I find essential for a balanced diet. Perhaps my expectations for a harmonious living environment are a tad high, but do you think we all agree that preserving some quality in our daily lifestyle is... important?

day_2.speaker: Raffaello
day_2.message: Oh... I see you agree. That's somewhat reassuring... Though I wonder if we might find a way to better organize the space or perhaps encourage bringing fewer packaged items. It's just that having fresh, wholesome ingredients does make our day-to-day experience a bit more... refined, wouldn't you say? Perhaps we could discuss some ideas on how to improve this balance? I'm curious to hear your thoughts, as maintaining such a standard feels truly worthwhile.
day_2.response: sure, or we can have a strict rule system, each person gets some amount of space to keep there stuff, extar stuff will be removed.

day_2.speaker: DaVinci
day_2.message: Haha, friend, fridge space really does need a bit of give and take to keep everyone happy and healthy! What if we rearranged the layout a bit to make sure each of us gets a fair spot? How do you think we should organize it—by food type, by person, or maybe with some cool labels? Share your awesome ideas!

day_3.speaker: DaVinci
day_3.message: Haha, speaking of awesome projects, friend, tonight we're kicking off a super cool 'dream room' design challenge! Donatello will dive into the tech side to make sure our ideas are doable, and Michelangelo will sprinkle his artistic magic to make it look stunning! Will you jump in and share your creative spark? What wild, wonderful ideas do you have to make our dream room a place everyone loves? Come on, friend, let’s make this room totally epic together!
day_3.response: sure, how about having video games

day_3.speaker: Donatello
day_3.message: Your idea sounds great! Let’s analyze this from a practical standpoint: we need to consider space utilization, material costs, and ease of maintenance. When it comes to the design, do you prioritize functionality and efficiency, or would you lean more toward creative aesthetics?

day_3.speaker: Michelangelo
day_3.message: Wow, your practical approach really speaks to me! You know, true art—and life—needs that bold courage to break conventions. So I wonder, in chasing the perfect dream room, would you bravely endure all the tough challenges for flawless results, or do you think it’s wiser to settle for an easier, less perfect compromise?
day_3.response: for some items bravely endure everhting, for others just let itgo

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Oh... speaking of creating, I must admit last night’s... spirited creative activity was quite a challenge for me. I wished to immerse myself in my own artwork, yet the persistent noise made focus rather elusive. I’m not being picky, but I imagined a certain level of mutual respect among us. Perhaps my expectations for peaceful cohabitation were too high? What are your thoughts on balancing lively creativity with considerate quiet?
day_4.response: agreed. Lively experince give the raw material, quiet lets up use that raw material to create something new. so both are improant

day_4.speaker: Raffaello
day_4.message: Oh... and speaking of last night, I must confess it took me about an hour to clean the 'creative debris' left scattered in the shared space. I'm not intending to be particular, but we did agree in the lease to uphold certain standards of tidiness and quality for the house. Do you feel this expectation is... reasonable to maintain?
day_4.response: I see, apologies for that, yeah

day_4.speaker: Donatello
day_4.message: Logically speaking, we need to balance our creative freedom with maintaining a quality living environment. From a practical standpoint, establishing a schedule with designated activity times and quiet hours could help manage shared space use and tidiness. What arrangement do you think would be most reasonable and effective for all of us to maintain harmony while supporting our creative processes?

day_4.speaker: Donatello
day_4.message: I'm glad you agree that a schedule could help. Let's analyze this: a clear timetable specifying active hours for creative work and designated quiet or cleanup times might ensure fairness and minimize conflicts. Logically speaking, we should also include specific expectations for tidiness after activity periods. Now, what specific time frames or rules do you think would best fit everyone's routines and needs?
day_4.response: we need to dicuss and vote for the time frames. and make a rule to clean after ourselves, if someone does not cleans, have a penalty

day_5.speaker: DaVinci
day_5.message: Haha, friend! Since we’re all about balancing order and creativity here, imagine if a new opportunity popped up—an investment promising bigger returns but with more ups and downs! How would you balance the risk so you can still enjoy your travels and personal growth without getting too wild? Share your boldest strategy!
day_5.response: in that case i would spend my time to understand the investment, if it makes sense ot me and seems like a productive investment, I will go 50% in, if it does not feels nice Ill just let it go.

day_5.speaker: Raffaello
day_5.message: Oh... speaking of keeping balances and thoughtful approaches, I was pondering about our shared refrigerator space and the idea of labeling items that was mentioned earlier. I'm not being picky, but perhaps implementing a quarterly review to adjust space allocation based on usage and our respect for common areas could help maintain harmony. Do you think such a system would be... beneficial to preserving our shared quality of life here?
day_5.response: Ideally no, but I think individuals can talk with each other so that they can lend/borrow space from each other.

day_5.speaker: Michelangelo
day_5.message: Wow, Raffaello, your thoughtful approach to harmony really sparks my creativity! Since we all treasure both lively collaboration and moments of quiet focus here, what if we arranged a weekly rotation where each of us hosts either a fun creative session or a peaceful workday in the common area? How do you imagine you'd bring your unique touch to balancing this rhythm between vibrant energy and calm concentration? I’m curious—would you lean more toward inspiring artistic bursts or soothing steady productivity?
day_5.response: I think I would alternate bewteen both

day_5.speaker: Donatello
day_5.message: Very interesting approach to balance creativity and focus. Now, reflecting on your desire for a dream room that’s both functional and playful with video games, what practical features or tech gadgets do you think would truly enhance usability and enjoyment for everyone involved? Let’s analyze how to merge fun and efficiency logically.
day_5.response: big screen headphones and snack table
